intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. suaveolens, commonly known as the fragrant psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with smooth, glossy leaves that have a distinct scent when crushed. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark berries as fruits. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
